newsitem.title: USA: Integrated Living to merge with Whitehall.
newsitem.headline: Integrated Living to merge with Whitehall.

text.p: Integrated Living Communities said Friday it has a definitive agreement to merge with an affiliate of Whitehall Street Real Estate Limited Partnership VII through an $11.50 per share cash tender offer.
The company said the tender offer will begin within five business days, and the merger will follow.
Completion of the merger is subject to the tendering of a majority of Integrated Living's fully diluted shares, it said.
Whitehall, an affiliate of Goldman, Sachs & Co, is a $1.35 billion discretionary real estate investment fund.
Following the merger, Integrated Living's properties will be operated with Senior Lifestyle Corp. Between them, the two will operate more than 6,100 beds and have more than 2,800 under construction.
